references.paper_title: What Matters in On-Policy Reinforcement Learning? A Large-Scale Empirical Study
references.reason: This paper provides a large-scale empirical study of various factors in on-policy reinforcement learning, offering valuable context for understanding hyperparameter sensitivity.
This paper introduces Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO), a widely-used reinforcement learning algorithm that is the focus of the experimental analysis in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Human-Level Control through Deep Reinforcement Learning
references.reason: This seminal paper introduced Deep Q-Networks (DQN), a foundational algorithm in reinforcement learning, whose evolution is discussed to highlight the growing complexity and number of hyperparameters in the field.

references.paper_title: Rainbow: Combining Improvements in Deep Reinforcement Learning
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the increasing number of hyperparameters in reinforcement learning algorithms through the development of the Rainbow DQN agent, providing further context for the study of hyperparameter sensitivity.

references.paper_title: Mastering Diverse Domains through World Models
references.reason: This paper introduces DreamerV3, a reinforcement learning algorithm with normalization techniques that are investigated in the current paper to assess the impact on hyperparameter sensitivity.
